qnas.answer: Wildlife Tours Rwanda allows full refund if you cancel 60 or more days before departure (loss of deposit). Between 30–59 days before trip, a cancellation charge of 50% applies. Within 30 days, 100% of the tour price is non‑refundable. No refunds once the trip starts.
questions: How late can I cancel my safari?

qnas.answer: Wildlife Tours Rwanda will not cancel any tour fewer than 60 days before departure. A tour is guaranteed once at least one traveler has paid in full, unless there is force majeure (e.g., political unrest). In such cases you may take an alternative trip or receive a full refund.

qnas.answer: Amending your booking 60+ days before departure incurs a USD 150 per person fee. Amendments within 60 days follow the cancellation fee schedule. No amendments are permitted within 10 days of departure.
questions: Can I change my booking dates?

qnas.answer: Bookings made within 15 days of departure incur a USD 50 late booking fee per booking.
questions: Is there a late booking fee?
Do you charge extra for late bookings?

qnas.answer: Most packages require a 30% deposit to confirm your booking, with the balance due before departure (typically 30–60 days out). Payment can be made via international bank transfer or credit card (Visa, Mastercard).
questions: How do I pay for a tour?

qnas.answer: Our safari packages include accommodation (tented camps, mid‑range or luxury lodges), full board meals, park entrance fees, professional English‑speaking guides, transport between parks, and daily activities as per itinerary. International flights and visa fees are not included.

qnas.answer: We offer gorilla trekking in Volcanoes National Park, chimpanzee tracking in Nyungwe Forest, Big Five game drives and boat cruises in Akagera, plus optional cultural village visits, bird‑watching, and community visits.

qnas.answer: Permits such as gorilla or chimpanzee tracking are purchased after deposit is received. Permit fees are non‑refundable and set by the Rwanda Development Board (~USD 1500 per gorilla permit).
You can upgrade or downgrade your lodge when booking or up to 60 days before departure (with applicable fees or price difference). No lodge changes permitted within 10 days of departure.
Travel insurance that covers medical emergencies, evacuation, cancellation, and trip interruption is strongly recommended. Visitors are responsible for securing appropriate insurance before travel.
Rwanda requires a tourist visa, which can be obtained online via e‑visa (~USD 50). Some nationalities can get a visa on arrival, but early application is advised.
questions: Do I need a visa for Rwanda?

qnas.answer: Some itineraries include only one park; you can combine Volcanoes, Nyungwe, and Akagera in multi‑park packages. Custom itineraries across multiple parks are available upon request.
We offer one‑day Big Five safari adventures in Akagera, two‑day gorilla encounters, and longer bespoke packages such as combined Volcanoes, Nyungwe, and Lake Kivu tours.
It usually takes about 7 hours to drive from Kigali to Akagera (rough roads), and 3‑4 hours to reach Volcanoes National Park. We schedule early departures to maximize your time on safari.
